document_title: Fungus of the external auditory canal: Causes, signs and treatments
subsection_name: nam-ong-tai-ngoai.json_3_Diagnosis method of external ear canal fungus
subsection_content:
Doctors exploit symptoms and otoscopy to diagnose external ear canal fungus. Otoscopic images include: ear canal swelling, congestion, pus in the ear canal, and especially characteristic fungal filaments or blue, black and white fungal plaques. In some cases, ear fungus has no symptoms or only has simple symptoms of prolonged ear itching, discovered accidentally through otoscopy, seeing fungal filaments growing on the earwax base.
When determining the causes of ear pain and ear discharge, the doctor will prescribe appropriate treatment for cases of bacterial external otitis media, acute otitis media, chronic cholesteatoma... (2 )
Endoscopic image of fungal external otitis
